completePage.title: Survey Completed

notice.title: Guidance on Procedure Eligibility
description: If any of the following apply to you, the procedure may be limited or require additional medical review.
Please be sure to check the details.
- Cerebrovascular disease (procedure eligibility reviewed if 1 year or more has passed since treatment or surgery)
- Cardiovascular disease (procedure eligibility reviewed if 1 year or more has passed since treatment or surgery)
- History of kidney transplant or patients currently on dialysis
- Thyroid disease or diabetes (eligibility determined based on condition and medical judgment)

q1.question: Have you had any plastic surgery or procedures before?

q1-1.question: Please provide details about the procedure type, area, and approximate time.
q1-1.placeholder: e.g., 2022 Abdominal Liposuction / 2023 Facial Thread Lifting

q2.question: Do you have any allergies to medications or anesthesia?

q2-1.question: Please provide specific details about the type of allergy and symptoms.
q2-1.placeholder: e.g., Lidocaine allergy – hives, difficulty breathing

q3.question: Are you currently taking any medications or health supplements?

q3-1.question: Please provide the names and dosages of all medications or health supplements you are taking.

notice.title: Important Notice
notice.description: If you are currently taking aspirin or blood-thinning medications, please consult with your doctor and discontinue use at least 7 days before the procedure.

q4.question: Do you have any current or past medical conditions, or medical history that healthcare providers should be aware of?
q4.placeholder:
e.g., Condition name / Diagnosis date / Current treatment status
(Thyroid disorder, diagnosed 2020, currently on medication)

q5.question: If you have any additional questions or concerns, please feel free to write them here.
q5.placeholder: e.g., I'm curious about recovery time, pain level, and scarring.

cautionSection.title: Important Notes
items: Limousine service is only available for hospital/procedure reservations when visiting Korea.
The limousine option can be selected during the reservation application stage after applying for a consultation.
Concierge service, such as hot places and restaurant tours in Korea, is provided for advance reservations.

items.title: Daily limousine usage fees are as follows.
details: - Supercar Lamborghini Urus: 1,080 USD per day
- Includes driver's fee, driver's meal, toll gate fees, and taxes
- Based on 8 hours of use from 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM
- Additional charges for extra hours: Supercar 150 USD/hour (on-site card payment)
- Fuel costs settled later (on-site card payment)
- Additional charges for driving outside Seoul (on-site card payment)

items: Payment is only possible based on 8 hours per day.
If short-term travel is needed, it is convenient to use international taxis or local taxi apps after arriving in Korea.

footer.address: 701-014, 103 Misagangbyeonnam-ro, Hanam-si, Gyeonggi-do, Republic of Korea

article1.title: Article 1 (Purpose)
article1.content: These Terms of Service (hereinafter referred to as "Terms") are established to prescribe the rights, obligations, and responsibilities between the Company and Members regarding the use of the K-DOC service (hereinafter referred to as "Service") operated by FILLMAN Inc. (hereinafter referred to as "Company"), as well as the conditions and procedures for using the Service, and other necessary matters.

article2.title: Article 2 (Definitions)
article2.intro: The definitions of terms used in these Terms are as follows. Terms used in these Terms that are not defined herein shall be interpreted in accordance with relevant laws and regulations and service-specific guidelines, and otherwise in accordance with general practice.
items: Service: All functions and related services that provide information registered by users and participating institutions regarding beauty procedures to "Members".
Member: A person who accesses the "Service", agrees to these Terms, provides personal information to the "Company", and registers as a "Member", and who can continuously use the "Service".

Partner Medical Institution: Medical institutions and related businesses participating in the "Service" that receive separate systems from the "Company" and register information about hospitals, medical staff, and medical procedures being performed to "Members".
Pre-payment Event: All procedure services sold by "Partner Medical Institutions" to "Members" through the Service as goods and services.
Pre-payment (Online Payment): The use or purchase of "Pre-payment Events" and products of "Partner Medical Institutions" using the purchase service within the "Service" provided by the "Company".
Procedure Voucher: A service usage right issued when purchasing "Pre-payment Events", "Products", etc. in the Service.

Discount Voucher: A discount benefit that allows "Members" to receive discounts on usage fees by the amount or percentage indicated when using the "Service". The issuance and use of "Discount Vouchers" are determined by the Company's operating policy.

Points: Virtual quantified data provided by the "Company" to "Members" for benefits or convenience in using the Service, which can be used when purchasing "Procedure Vouchers", "Products", etc. within the Service. The issuance and use of "Points" are determined by the Company's operating policy.
Post: Symbols (including URLs), text, voice, sound, video (including moving images), images (including photos), files, etc. posted or registered by "Members" on the service provided by the Company.

article3.title: Article 3 (Posting and Amendment of Terms)
items: The Company posts the contents of these Terms on the Service or its connected screens so that Members can easily view them.

The Company may amend these Terms within the scope that does not violate related laws such as the "Act on the Regulation of Terms and Conditions" (hereinafter referred to as "Terms Act") and the "Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection" (hereinafter referred to as "Information and Communications Network Act").

When the Company amends the Terms, it shall notify Members of the application date and reason for amendment from 7 days before the application date of the amended Terms until the day before the application date. However, in case of amendments to the Terms that are unfavorable to Members, the Company shall notify 30 days before the application date of the amended Terms or separately notify clearly through electronic means such as email, electronic messages, or consent windows at login within the Service. Notwithstanding such notice or notification, the Company shall not be liable for any damages incurred by Members due to not being aware of information about the changed Terms.

If a Member continues to use the Company's Service after the Terms have been changed, it shall be deemed that the Member has agreed to the amended Terms. If a Member does not agree to the amended Terms, the Member may request withdrawal (termination) of membership.

Matters not specified in these Terms and the interpretation of these Terms shall be governed by the "Act on the Regulation of Terms and Conditions", the "Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection", related laws and regulations, or general commercial practices.

article4.title: Article 4 (Supplementary Provisions and Relationship with Related Laws)
items: The Company may establish individual terms or operating principles (hereinafter referred to as "Service-Specific Guidelines") for individual items within the Service when necessary, and in case of conflict between the contents of these Terms and the Service-Specific Guidelines, the contents of the Service-Specific Guidelines shall take precedence.

Matters not specified in these Terms or the Service-Specific Guidelines shall be governed by the provisions of related laws and regulations such as the Telecommunications Business Act, the Basic Act on Electronic Commerce, the Information and Communications Network Act, the Act on Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, the Personal Information Protection Act, etc., and general commercial practices.

article5.title: Article 5 (Formation of Use Agreement)
items: The use agreement is concluded when a person who wishes to become a member (hereinafter referred to as "applicant") agrees to the contents of these Terms, fills in member information (ID, password, name, contact information, email address, etc.) according to the membership form prescribed by the Company, applies for membership, and the Company approves such application.

items.content: The Company shall, in principle, approve the use of the Service for applications from applicants. However, the Company may not approve or may terminate the use agreement after the fact for applications that fall under any of the following:
subItems: When the applicant has previously lost membership status under these Terms
When using another person's name or phone number, or when the phone number or email address is the same as that of an already registered member

When approval is impossible due to the user's fault, such as entering false information or failing to enter the contents presented by the Company, or when applying in violation of other prescribed matters
When intending to use this Service for improper purposes or for profit-seeking purposes

When applying for illegal or improper purposes, such as violating related laws and regulations or these Terms, or potentially disrupting social order or good morals, and the Company reasonably deems it necessary

items: In applications pursuant to paragraph 1, the Company may request real-name verification and identity authentication through specialized institutions depending on the type of member.
The Company may reserve approval when there is no surplus in service-related facilities or when there are technical or business problems.
When the Company does not approve or reserves approval of a membership application pursuant to paragraphs 2 and 4, the Company shall, in principle, notify the applicant thereof.
The time of formation of the use agreement is the time when the Company indicates completion of membership in the application procedure.

article6.title: Article 6 (Termination of Use Agreement)

items.title: 1. Member's Termination
subItems: A member may terminate the use agreement at any time by notifying the Company of their intention to terminate or by terminating the use agreement through the [Settings] menu within the Service.
The Company shall process the member's termination request pursuant to the preceding paragraph immediately unless there are special circumstances.
A member may be restricted from re-registering for a period determined by the Company after notifying the Company of their intention to terminate.

items.title: 2. Company's Termination

subItems.content: The Company may terminate the use agreement when there are reasons falling under any of the following. In such cases, the Company shall notify the member of the intention to terminate by disclosing the reason for termination through email, phone, fax, messages, or other means.
subSubItems: When it is confirmed that there are reasons for refusal of approval of the use agreement as prescribed in Article 5, Paragraph 2
When a member has engaged in acts that infringe upon the rights, reputation, credit, or other legitimate interests of the Company or other persons
When a member has engaged in acts that violate these Terms or when reasons for termination as prescribed in these Terms have occurred

subItems: The use agreement is terminated when the Company notifies the member of its intention to terminate.

items: When a member voluntarily terminates the use agreement pursuant to Paragraph 1 of this Article, or when the use agreement is terminated due to the member's fault pursuant to Paragraph 2, any damages arising therefrom shall be borne by the relevant member whose use agreement has been terminated, and the Company shall not bear any responsibility.

description.part1: K-DOC is a service planned by a team of medical professionals from
description.part2: , led by Dr. Woo Jung-ho, a global authority in the medical field. Our headquarters, located in a landmark building in Apgujeong, leads global beauty trends, and Dr. Woo, widely known as the 'Master of Thread Lifting' even in Japan, has been featured in prominent international media such as FOX TV News.

woo.description: FOX TV News in the U.S. broadcast 'Non-Surgical Thread Lifting Revolution'
woo.name: President Woo Jung Ho

ceoGreeting.title: CEO Greetings
ceoGreeting.name: President Woo Jung Ho M.D.
content: K-DOC is Korea's premier medical beauty platform, created to guide Thai clients in selecting only the top 5% of plastic surgery and dermatology clinics in Korea—clinics you can truly trust—while also offering exclusive discount benefits.

Our management team includes myself, Dr. Woo Jung Ho, M.D., a world-renowned authority in thread lifting and non-invasive aesthetic procedures, along with Dr. Park Jong Hyeon, M.D., and other distinguished medical professionals educated at some of the world's leading universities. Together, we take great pride in planning and operating this platform. Above all, K-DOC is designed to guide international patients, including those from Thailand, toward safe, verified, and trustworthy medical services in Korea—ensuring that you experience the very best of Korean medical expertise.

Through this platform, you will have access to reliable information on Korea's most reputable aesthetic clinics, authentic treatment reviews, and comprehensive services—from hospital booking and professional interpretation to post-treatment care—all in one place.

K-DOC is not merely an information platform. We aspire to be your trusted and convenient partner in your Korean medical beauty journey, providing each and every client with tailored solutions and a safe, satisfying experience.

We sincerely hope you can experience Korea's advanced aesthetic medical technologies safely, without risk, and with complete peace of mind. K-DOC will be with you every step of the way toward greater beauty, confidence, and health.
Dr. Woo Jung Ho Chief Executive Officer

seoulOffice.title: K-DOC Seoul Office
seoulOffice.description: K-DOC Tower, a landmark located on Apgujeong Rodeo Street, Seoul's most famous street in Gangnam

sections.title: 2025 Thailand Expansion
sections.description:
K-DOC, a global plastic surgery medical platform for Thai customers!
K-DOC carefully selects only the top 5% of Korea's leading plastic surgery and dermatology clinics to help Thai customers choose with confidence.

sections.title: Essential Plastic Surgery Platform for Customers
sections.description: View desired procedures and plastic surgery information in Korea at a glance, compare real reviews and hospital information to make confident decisions. Experience everything from booking to interpretation and post-procedure care conveniently through K-DOC.

sections.title: Introduction to Korea's Famous Hospitals
sections.description: K-DOC only partners with world-renowned medical professionals and verified leading Korean plastic surgery clinics. Thai and global customers can experience high-quality plastic surgery services through trusted medical professionals and safe systems.

certification.title: Govt-licensed medical facilitator
certification.description:
K-DOC is an officially registered foreign patient attraction agency under the Korea Health Industry Development Institute (KHIDI), an organization affiliated with the Ministry of Health and Welfare of the Republic of Korea. We have passed the strict screening and qualification standards set by the national authorities.

Furthermore, we are a certified corporation enrolled in a KRW 100 million (about USD 70,000) licensing guarantee insurance policy with Seoul Guarantee Insurance (SGI), thereby holding an official government-approved qualification to deliver safe and reliable medical services to international patients.

Moving forward, we will continue to collaborate with leading Korean medical institutions to deliver professional, transparent, and globally trusted healthcare services.
certification.certificateLabel: Certificate of Registration for Foreign Patient Attraction Business

governmentCertified.title:
Government Certified
Medical Tourism
Platform
governmentCertified.description:
K-DOC is a foreign patient attraction company officially registered with the Korea Health Industry Development Institute (KHIDI) under the Ministry of Health and Welfare, and is an officially certified platform that has passed the strict screening standards of national institutions.

In addition, we are enrolled in Seoul Guarantee Insurance (SGI) 100 million won license guarantee insurance to provide safe and reliable medical services to foreign patients.
governmentCertified.certificateLabel: Certificate of Registration for Foreign Patient Attraction Business

visionV2.subtitle:
Becoming the standard for medical choices
that patients worldwide can trust

sections.title: Global Medical Platform
sections.description: K-DOC carefully selects only the top 10% of plastic surgery and dermatology clinics in Korea to help global customers choose with confidence based on trust.

sections.title: Your Trusted Choice
sections.description: We help you easily check desired procedures and hospital information in Korea at a glance, and choose with confidence through real review comparisons. You can conveniently experience all processes in one place, from reservations to interpretation and post-procedure care.

sections.title: Curated Clinics & Hospitals
sections.description: Only Korea's leading plastic surgery and dermatology clinics and hospitals that have been carefully selected through strict criteria are part of K-DOC. Global customers can experience high-quality plastic surgery services through a safe system through medical institutions that have undergone K-DOC's verification process.
